canonical_explanation.text: Many people help us every day. A doctor makes us well when we are sick. A teacher teaches us at school. A police officer keeps us safe. A firefighter puts out fires. A farmer grows food for us. A postman delivers our letters. We should respect and thank all these helpers for their hard work.
rules: Community helpers are people who help us in our daily life.
A doctor treats sick people using a stethoscope and medicines.
A teacher teaches us in school using chalk, board, and books.
A police officer keeps us safe and catches bad people.
A firefighter puts out fires and saves people from burning buildings.
A farmer grows rice, wheat, vegetables, and fruits for us to eat.
We should always respect and say thank you to all helpers.

questions.question_text: Who treats us when we are sick?
questions.explanation_correct: A doctor treats us when we are sick. Doctors check our body, give us medicine, and help us get well.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A teacher teaches us, a farmer grows food, and a postman delivers letters. When we are sick, we go to a doctor.

questions.question_text: Who teaches us at school?
questions.explanation_correct: A teacher teaches us at school. Teachers help us learn to read, write, and do maths.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Doctors treat sick people, firefighters put out fires, and police officers keep us safe. A teacher is the one who teaches us at school.

questions.question_text: Who grows food for us?
questions.explanation_correct: A farmer grows food for us. Farmers work hard in the fields to grow rice, wheat, vegetables, and fruits.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A postman delivers letters, a shopkeeper sells things, and a driver drives vehicles. A farmer is the person who grows food for us.

questions.question_text: Who delivers letters to our house?
questions.explanation_correct: The postman delivers letters to our house. The postman collects letters from the post office and brings them to our home.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Farmers grow food, teachers teach, and doctors treat sick people. The postman is the one who delivers letters to our house.

questions.question_text: Who puts out fires?
questions.explanation_correct: A firefighter puts out fires. Firefighters are very brave. They use water hoses and fire engines to put out fires.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Police officers catch criminals, doctors treat the sick, and teachers teach. A firefighter is the person who puts out fires.

questions.question_text: Who keeps us safe and catches bad people?
questions.explanation_correct: A police officer keeps us safe and catches bad people. Police officers wear uniforms and help maintain law and order.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Farmers grow food, postmen deliver letters, and shopkeepers sell things. A police officer is the one who keeps us safe.

questions.question_text: Which tool does a doctor use to listen to our heartbeat?
questions.explanation_correct: A doctor uses a stethoscope to listen to our heartbeat. The stethoscope helps the doctor check if our heart is beating properly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A hammer is a building tool, chalk is used by teachers, and a hose is used by firefighters. A doctor uses a stethoscope.

questions.question_text: What does a teacher use to write on the blackboard?
questions.explanation_correct: A teacher uses chalk to write on the blackboard. Some teachers also use a whiteboard and marker.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A stethoscope is for doctors, a water hose is for firefighters, and a plough is for farmers. Teachers use chalk to write on the blackboard.

questions.question_text: What does a firefighter use to spray water on a fire?
questions.explanation_correct: A firefighter uses a water hose to spray water on a fire. The hose is connected to a fire engine that carries a lot of water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A stethoscope is for doctors, chalk is for teachers, and a letter bag is for postmen. Firefighters use a water hose to put out fires.

questions.question_text: Who drives a bus to take us places?
questions.explanation_correct: A bus driver drives the bus to take us places. Bus drivers help people travel from one place to another safely.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Farmers grow food, teachers teach, and postmen deliver letters. A bus driver is the person who drives the bus.

questions.question_text: We should respect and thank all community helpers.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. All community helpers work hard to make our lives better. We should always respect and thank them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is true. Every community helper does important work for us, and we should always be grateful and respectful.

questions.question_text: A farmer works in a hospital.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. A farmer works in the fields, not in a hospital. Doctors and nurses work in hospitals.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is false. Farmers work in fields growing crops. It is doctors and nurses who work in hospitals.

questions.question_text: Ravi has a fever and cough. Who should his mother take him to?
questions.explanation_correct: Ravi's mother should take him to a doctor. The doctor will check him, give medicine, and help him get better.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Teachers teach at school, police officers keep us safe, and farmers grow food. When someone is sick, they should see a doctor.

questions.question_text: There is a fire in a building! Who should we call for help?
questions.explanation_correct: We should call the firefighters. They will come with their fire engine and water hoses to put out the fire.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Postmen deliver letters, teachers teach, and shopkeepers sell things. When there is a fire, we call the firefighters.

questions.question_text: What does a farmer use to plough the field?
questions.explanation_correct: A farmer uses a plough and tractor to plough the field. The plough digs the soil so seeds can be planted.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A stethoscope is for doctors, chalk is for teachers, and a fire engine is for firefighters. Farmers use a plough and tractor.

questions.question_text: Who keeps the streets and roads clean?
questions.explanation_correct: A sweeper keeps the streets and roads clean. Sweepers work early in the morning to clean our surroundings.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Doctors treat sick people, teachers teach, and farmers grow food. A sweeper is the person who keeps our streets clean.

questions.question_text: Who sells things in a shop?
questions.explanation_correct: A shopkeeper sells things in a shop. We buy rice, vegetables, soap, and many other things from the shopkeeper.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Postmen deliver letters, doctors treat sick people, and firefighters put out fires. A shopkeeper sells things in a shop.

questions.question_text: Meena sees someone stealing a bicycle. Who should she tell?
questions.explanation_correct: Meena should tell a police officer. The police officer's job is to catch thieves and keep everyone safe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Farmers grow food, doctors treat sick people, and postmen deliver letters. When someone steals, we should tell the police officer.

questions.question_text: A person is wearing a white coat and has a stethoscope around the neck. Who is this person?
questions.explanation_correct: This person is a doctor. Doctors often wear white coats and carry a stethoscope to check patients.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Teachers wear regular clothes, police officers wear khaki uniforms, and farmers wear work clothes. A white coat with a stethoscope means the person is a doctor.

questions.question_text: A person is wearing a khaki uniform and carrying a whistle. Who is this person?
questions.explanation_correct: This person is a police officer. Police officers in India wear khaki uniforms and use whistles to control traffic.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Doctors wear white coats, farmers wear work clothes, and postmen wear their postal uniform. A khaki uniform with a whistle means the person is a police officer.

questions.question_text: Who cooks food in a restaurant or school?
questions.explanation_correct: A cook prepares food in a restaurant or school. Cooks make tasty and healthy food for many people to eat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Doctors treat people, postmen deliver letters, and police officers keep us safe. A cook is the person who prepares food.

questions.question_text: Who drives an auto-rickshaw?
questions.explanation_correct: An auto-rickshaw driver drives an auto-rickshaw. Auto-rickshaws are a common way of travelling in Indian cities and towns.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Farmers work in fields, teachers work in schools, and doctors work in hospitals. An auto-rickshaw driver drives the auto-rickshaw.

questions.question_text: A teacher works in a school.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. A teacher works in a school. Teachers teach children how to read, write, and learn new things.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is true. Teachers do work in schools where they teach and help children learn.

questions.question_text: The sweeper cleans your street every morning. What should you say to them?

options.text: Nothing, they are just doing their job
Thank you for keeping our street clean
Why are you here so early?

questions.explanation_correct: We should say 'Thank you for keeping our street clean.' Every helper deserves respect and a kind word for their hard work.
questions.explanation_incorrect: It is not nice to ignore or be rude to people who help us. We should always thank the sweeper for keeping our streets clean.

questions.question_text: What does a postman carry?
questions.explanation_correct: A postman carries a letter bag full of letters and parcels. The postman delivers them to people's homes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A stethoscope is for doctors, a fire hose is for firefighters, and a plough is for farmers. A postman carries a letter bag.

questions.question_text: Without farmers, what would happen?

options.text: We would have no food to eat

questions.explanation_correct: Without farmers, we would have no food to eat. Farmers grow the rice, wheat, vegetables, and fruits that we eat every day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Letters come from postmen, schools need teachers, and police officers keep law. Without farmers, we would have no food because they grow all our food.

questions.question_text: A person is wearing a red helmet and driving a big red truck with a ladder. Who is this person?
questions.explanation_correct: This person is a firefighter. Firefighters wear red helmets and drive fire engines (big red trucks with ladders) to put out fires.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bus drivers drive buses, police officers wear khaki, and farmers work in fields. A red helmet and big red truck means the person is a firefighter.

questions.question_text: Why should we respect community helpers?

options.text: Because they work hard to help us every day

questions.explanation_correct: We should respect community helpers because they work hard to help us every day. Without them, our life would be very difficult.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We respect helpers not because they are rich or give us toys, but because they work hard every day to make our lives better.

questions.question_text: A police officer uses a stethoscope.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. A police officer does not use a stethoscope. A stethoscope is used by a doctor. Police officers use whistles and walkie-talkies.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is false. A stethoscope is a doctor's tool, not a police officer's. Police officers use whistles and walkie-talkies.

questions.question_text: Sita wants to learn to read and write. Who will help her?
questions.explanation_correct: A teacher will help Sita learn to read and write. Teachers help children learn many new things at school.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Doctors help sick people, firefighters put out fires, and shopkeepers sell things. A teacher helps children learn to read and write.

questions.question_text: Match the helper with the tool: Doctor - Stethoscope, Teacher - Chalk, Firefighter - ?
questions.explanation_correct: A firefighter uses a water hose. Just as a doctor uses a stethoscope and a teacher uses chalk, a firefighter uses a water hose to put out fires.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A plough is for farmers, a letter bag is for postmen. A firefighter uses a water hose to spray water on fires.

questions.question_text: Who helps us cross the road safely near the school?
questions.explanation_correct: A traffic police officer helps us cross the road safely. They stand at crossings and manage traffic so everyone is safe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Farmers work in fields, postmen deliver letters, and cooks prepare food. A traffic police officer helps us cross the road safely.

questions.question_text: A farmer works very hard in the sun and rain. How should we feel about the food we eat?

options.text: We should be thankful and not waste food
We should eat only junk food

questions.explanation_correct: We should be thankful and not waste food. Farmers work very hard to grow our food, so we should respect their effort.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wasting food is wrong because farmers work so hard to grow it. We should always be thankful and eat without wasting.

questions.question_text: Where does a doctor usually work?
questions.explanation_correct: A doctor usually works in a hospital or clinic. Patients go there to get checked and treated when they are sick.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Fields are for farmers, fire stations for firefighters, and post offices for postmen. A doctor works in a hospital or clinic.

questions.question_text: Where does a firefighter work?
questions.explanation_correct: A firefighter works at a fire station. When there is a fire, firefighters rush from the fire station to help.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Schools are for teachers, hospitals for doctors, and farms for farmers. Firefighters work at a fire station.

questions.question_text: Only some helpers are important, not all.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. ALL community helpers are important. The sweeper, farmer, doctor, teacher â€” every helper makes our life better.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is false. Every community helper is important. Without any one of them, our daily life would become difficult.

questions.question_text: Which helper does NOT wear a special uniform for work?
questions.explanation_correct: A farmer usually does not wear a special uniform. Police officers, doctors, and firefighters wear uniforms, but farmers wear regular work clothes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Police officers wear khaki uniforms, doctors wear white coats, and firefighters wear special fire-resistant suits. Farmers wear regular work clothes.

questions.question_text: Anu's grandmother needs medicine. Who will help?
questions.explanation_correct: A doctor will help Anu's grandmother. The doctor will check her and give her the right medicine to feel better.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Farmers grow food, postmen deliver letters, and sweepers clean streets. A doctor is the one who gives medicine to sick people.

questions.question_text: A person is carrying a big bag with many letters. Who is this person?
questions.explanation_correct: This person is a postman. Postmen carry a big bag full of letters and deliver them to our homes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Shopkeepers sell things, teachers teach, and drivers drive vehicles. A person carrying a bag of letters is a postman.

questions.question_text: What is the BEST way to show respect to a community helper?

options.text: Say thank you and be polite

questions.explanation_correct: The best way to show respect is to say thank you and be polite. Being kind to helpers shows we value their hard work.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ignoring, making fun of, or shouting at helpers is very rude. We should always say thank you and be polite to community helpers.

questions.question_text: Which community helper works with animals?
questions.explanation_correct: A veterinarian is an animal doctor. They treat sick animals just like a doctor treats sick people.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Postmen deliver letters, firefighters put out fires, and sweepers clean streets. A veterinarian is the doctor who treats sick animals.

questions.question_text: Ram's mother makes beautiful clothes for people. What is her job?
questions.explanation_correct: Ram's mother is a tailor. A tailor stitches and makes clothes for people to wear.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Farmers grow food, doctors treat patients, and sweepers clean. A person who makes clothes is called a tailor.

questions.question_text: A firefighter uses chalk and a blackboard.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. A firefighter does not use chalk and a blackboard. Those are tools used by a teacher. A firefighter uses a water hose and fire engine.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is false. Chalk and a blackboard are used by teachers. Firefighters use water hoses, fire engines, and helmets.

questions.question_text: When you see a police officer directing traffic, what should you do?
questions.explanation_correct: We should follow the police officer's signals. The traffic police officer is there to help everyone cross the road safely.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ignoring signals or running across the road is very dangerous. We must always follow the police officer's signals for our safety.

questions.question_text: Which pair is CORRECT?
questions.explanation_correct: Farmer - Field is correct. Farmers work in the field to grow crops. Doctors work in hospitals, teachers in schools, and postmen in post offices.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Doctors work in hospitals (not fire stations), teachers work in schools (not hospitals), and postmen work in post offices (not schools). Farmers work in fields.

questions.question_text: Which tool belongs to a farmer?
questions.explanation_correct: A sickle belongs to a farmer. Farmers use a sickle to cut and harvest crops in the field.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A stethoscope is for doctors, a whistle for police officers, and a fire hose for firefighters. A sickle is the tool used by farmers.

questions.question_text: Your teacher is feeling tired after teaching all day. What should you do?

options.text: Thank the teacher and behave well

questions.explanation_correct: We should thank our teacher and behave well. Teachers work very hard to help us learn, and we should show them respect.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Making noise, running away, or laughing is disrespectful. We should thank our teacher for working hard and behave well in class.

questions.question_text: A shopkeeper helps us by selling things we need every day.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. A shopkeeper sells things like food, soap, notebooks, and many other things we need in our daily life.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is true. Shopkeepers are community helpers who sell us the things we need every day.

questions.question_text: Who among these works at night to keep us safe while we sleep?
questions.explanation_correct: A night watchman (chowkidar) works at night to keep us safe while we sleep. They guard our buildings and neighbourhoods.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Teachers, farmers, and postmen usually work during the day. A night watchman (chowkidar) works at night to keep everyone safe.

questions.question_text: When you grow up, you can become a community helper too. Which of these is the right reason to become a helper?

options.text: To help people and make the world better

questions.explanation_correct: The right reason to become a community helper is to help people and make the world better. Helpers serve others with love and care.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Community helpers do not work to become famous or boss others around. They work to help people and make the world a better place.
